page.title: 04Local News,Wick
page.content: It was reported in the John O'Groat Journal in May 1985 that meetings had been held in all four primary schools in Wick to discuss the possibility of closing one school, owing to the falling roll.We, as pupils of Pulteneytown Academy School, hope our school will be kept open. In the last three years our Parent Teachers' Association have been helping the school by raising money at different events-Christmas Fayre, Barbecue, Beetle Drive.On these occasions parents come and enjoy themselves.The money goes to the school funds. We now have five computers, disc drives and a printer,which have allowed us to take part in the Domesday Project.
